author: adityapatwardhan
body:
Fix #7283 

## PR Summary

* Formatting changes moved from types file to formatting file.
* Add logic to check VT100 support before adding VT100 escape sequences.
* Add online help uris.
* Add positional parameters for Convert-FromMarkdown and Set-MarkdownOption

- [X] [Make sure all `.h`, `.cpp`, `.cs`, `.ps1` and `.psm1` files have the correct copyright header](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---submission)
- [X] This PR is ready to merge and is not [Work in Progress](https://github.com/PowerShell/PowerShell/blob/master/.github/CONTRIBUTING.md#pull-request---work-in-progress).

comments.author: iSazonov
comments.body:
Usually we use
```c#
[Alias("PSPath", "LP")]
```
for LiteralPath parameters.

comments.author: rkeithhill
comments.body: 👍 for positional parameter support. When `ConvertFrom-Markdown .\README.md` generated an error, I was bummed.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: On macOS using the Terminal app, it doesn't seem to display the VT100 inverted sequence so the text becomes unreadable since the color is supposed to be black on inverted background but just appears as black.  A basic web search doesn't find anything on how to support this so we may need to special case macOS to use some other colors.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body:
I take back part of what I said.  Inverse works for Headers like

```markdown
# header
```

But this only renders as black text on black background

```markdown
`text`
```
